resources.string: The #1 Thing To Remember With Meetings
Which is the core principle you have to remember with meetings?
It is important to go to every single meeting, especially as junior engineer
They are inherently expensive, as they are a pure usage of time
They are necessary for status updates
True or false: It is safer to just keep attending a meeting series, even if you are not clear exactly what value you are getting from it.
You have a meeting series where there is always action, but there is always an awkward portion at the end where people run out of topics. What should you do?
Decrease the length of the meeting
Delete the meeting
Invite more people to the meeting, so you have more to talk about
True or false: When in doubt of a meeting\'s value prop, just delete it. You can always bring it back later.
You have a 1 on 1 meeting series, and by the time of the meeting, you feel like there are a lot of issues that you two are getting to too late. What should you do?
Decrease the length of the meeting
Increase the frequency of the meeting
Push for the team to work on projects more slowly
Making Every Single Meeting You Have Effective
What do you absolutely need to with every single meeting in order to make it effective?
Talk a lot
Tell people what to do
Have a goal or set of goals for that meeting to achieve
What is the most important question you should be asking yourself constantly during a meeting?
Did someone say something wrong that I need to call out?
Is the meeting achieving its goal(s)?
How do I talk more during this meeting?
